item.title: Pirate The World Script!
item.dc:creator: @jason2gs jason2gs
item.description:
@jason2gs wrote:

Bring up the game screen to PTW
Target the black area of the game, not the whole window
Either click on the game screen and press Ctrl + Alt + R; or make sure the entire game screen is visable (sp?) and click ‘Run’.

Apparently it doesn’t work on FireFox, I’m not sure about that yet, though.

My screen res. is set at 1280 x 800, that’s what it works in.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirate The World Script!
item.dc:creator: @jason2gs jason2gs
item.description:
@jason2gs wrote:

A good script to run for the game ‘Pirate the World’.

Link to the game:

http://www.piratetheworld.com/

It plays the game for you (searches islands, attacks towns, and buys enhancements).

Does everything except attack other pirates. If you could find a way to do this, then by all means post it here

To buy upgrade:

To buy your upgrades, simply put in the number for the upgrade you want (inside the script).

It’ll pick a certain coord, and, if you have enough cash, buy that enhancement.[br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2006, 09:01:02 PM[/size][hr]It’s been downloaded!

Now comment, please?

Decided to post a script for all you non-downloaders/leeches

[code]{.Script Info:

ScriptName = PTW Macro

Author = Jason

Description = Autos Pirate the World for you.

Version = 2.0 (first one didn’t have an upgrade picker on it)

Date = 12-23-2006/21-24-2006

Comments = Just bring up the game screen, target it, and run the script.

/Script Info}

program PirateTheWorld;
const

// Cannons = 1
// Hull = 2
// Radar = 3
// Crew = 4
// Observation = 5
// Navigation = 6
// Ship = 7

Upgrade=‘Place upgrade # here’;

procedure Ptw;
begin
clickmouse(365, 427, True);
sleep(750)
clickMouse(569, 540, True);
sleep(750)
clickMouse(569, 555, True);
sleep(750)

// Upgrade picker- Start

 begin
  if(upgrade='1')then

clickMouse(576, 322, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘2’)then
clickMouse(576, 340, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘3’)then
clickMouse(576, 357, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘4’)then
clickMouse(576, 374, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘5’)then
clickMouse(376, 391, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘6’)then
clickMouse(576, 410, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘7’)then
clickMouse(576, 430, True);
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;

sleep(750)

// Upgrade picker- End

clickMouse(639, 193, True);
sleep(750)
clickmouse(365, 427, True);
sleep(750)
clickMouse(569, 540, True);
sleep(750)
clickMouse(569, 555, True);
sleep(750)
begin
if(upgrade=‘1’)then
clickMouse(576, 322, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘2’)then
clickMouse(576, 340, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘3’)then
clickMouse(576, 357, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘4’)then
clickMouse(576, 374, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘5’)then
clickMouse(376, 391, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘6’)then
clickMouse(576, 410, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘7’)then
clickMouse(576, 430, True);
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;

sleep(750)

clickMouse(639, 193, True);
sleep(750)
clickMouse(437, 356, True);
sleep(750)
clickMouse(569, 540, True);
sleep(750)
clickMouse(569, 555, True);
sleep(750)
begin
if(upgrade=‘1’)then
clickMouse(576, 322, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘2’)then
clickMouse(576, 340, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘3’)then
clickMouse(576, 357, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘4’)then
clickMouse(576, 374, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘5’)then
clickMouse(376, 391, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘6’)then
clickMouse(576, 410, True);
begin
if(upgrade=‘7’)then
clickMouse(576, 430, True);
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;
end;

sleep(750)

clickMouse(639, 193, True);
sleep(750)
end;

begin
repeat
Ptw;
until(false)
end.[/code][br][size=1]Posted on: December 25, 2006, 12:05:35 AM[/size][hr]Six downloads. 60-70 views. And no replies yet? Hmmm…
